metadata.description: Environment, including geographic location, for Power Automate - Ex for commercial: https://flow.microsoft.com/manage/environments/

inputs.name: FlowName
inputs.value: Admin | Sync Template v3 (Sync Flow Errors)

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Some of the Sync Flows in the CoE Starter Kit have failed. See below and navigate to the Flow Instance URL to find out more details:

Failures

inputs.name: ActionName
inputs.value: Send Republish Mail to Owner Apps

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
PowerApps

Keep your app updated to stay compliant.

You own an app that's currently shared or used broadly but which has not been published recently. It is best practice to test and republish such apps regularly in order to ensure they stay up to date with product changes.
Please test and republish the app. You can use the Developer Compliance Center app to view all required work.
How to become compliant

  1. Follow the link below
  2. View all apps that require work.
  3. Test and republish this app.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Keep your app updated to stay compliant

inputs.name: FlowName
inputs.value: Env Request | Notify requestor when rejected

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
The request to create an environment was rejected. See below for more information about this decision.

You can view all your requests and make a new one in the Environment Request app.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Your Environment Creation Request was rejected

inputs.name: ActionName
inputs.value: Send Over Capacity Envts to Admin

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value: The following environments are over their approved capacity:

inputs.name: ActionName
inputs.value: Send Near Capacity Envts to Admin

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value: The following environments are at 80% of their approved capacity:

inputs.name: ActionName
inputs.value: Send Audit Mail to Owner Apps

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Your admin needs details about your broadly shared app.

You own an app that's currently shared or used broadly and missing compliance details, which means it needs to be audited by an administrator per our support policy.
Please complete the business justification details in the Developer Compliance Center app to document the intended use.

How to become compliant

  1. Follow the link below
  2. Add a description to your app.
  3. Provide a business justification.
  4. Iterate the solution's dependencies.
  5. Provide details on the solution's access managment.
  6. Select the business impact.
  7. Select the data classification.
  8. Provide a Mitigation plan in the form of an attachment.
  9. Update the 'Mitigation plan provided' toggle to 'Yes'.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Submit compliance details for your app

inputs.name: ActionName
inputs.value: Send Audit Mail to Owner Bots

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
You own a chatbot that's frequently used and which missing compliance details, which means it needs to be audited by an administrator per our support policy.
Please complete the business justification details in the Developer Compliance Center app to document the intended use.

How to become compliant

  1. Follow the link below
  2. Add a description.
  3. Provide a business justification.
  4. Iterate the solution's dependencies.
  5. Provide details on the solution's access managment.
  6. Select the business impact.
  7. Provide a Mitigation plan in the form of an attachment.
  8. Update the 'Mitigation plan provided' toggle to 'Yes'.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Submit compliance details for your chatbot

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Welcome to Microsoft Power Platform!

Power Automate is an online workflow service that is licensed through our Office 365 entitlement. It is capable of automating events across common apps and services. The Flow service contains over 300 connectors, including corporate and consumer-based services.

Power Apps is a suite of apps, services, connectors and data platform that provides a rapid application development environment to build custom apps. Quickly build custom business apps that connect to business data, from the same set of connectors is used by Flow.

  • Power Automate Documentation
  • Power Apps Documentation
  • Power Automate Guided Learning
  • Power Apps Guided Learning
  • Learning Resources Blog
  • Power Automate Community Blog
  • PowerApps Community

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Welcome to Power Apps and Power Automate

inputs.name: FlowName
inputs.value: Env Request | Notify admin when new request submitted

inputs.name: ActionName
inputs.value: Send email a new request is ready for admin review

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
A new Environment Creation Request was submitted.

View request details and find the best DLP Policy configuration to accomodate the requested connectors with the Environment Request Admin App.


Instructions

1. Go to the Environment Request Admin App
2. Find and select the request
3. Use the app to see how adding the new environment to DLP Policies will impact the requested connectors. Any modifications made in the app will be processed when the environment is created.

Details

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: New Power Platform Environment Creation Request

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Your new Power Platform Environment has been created.
Your request to create the new Power Platform environment has been approved. You are now the adminstrator of the environment.

Access your environment in the maker portal here:

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Your new Power Platform Environment is Live

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Notice: There was a problem provisioning the Environment.
The approved Environment Creation Request was not completed, and the record has been closed. Please evaluate the error message and review the issue in the flow run history, then re-submit the request.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: There was an issue processing an Environment Creation Request

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Your Environment has been cleaned up.
The Environment below has been deleted. The database can be restored by your admin for up to 7 days.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Your Power Platform Environment has been deleted

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
There was a problem cleaning up an environment.

There was an issue deleting an environment that was created by an Environment Creation Request. Please confirm if the environment still exists and mange it further (e.g., delete the environment manually) in the Power Platform Admin Center (https://admin.powerplatform.microsoft.com).

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Notice: Closing the Environment Creation Request record.
An environment provisioned from an Environment Creation Request ticket that was scheduled to be cleaned up, but was not found.

This is a notification that the ticket is being closed. No further action is needed.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Closing the Environment Creation Request record. [No Action Required]

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value: Your Power Platform Environment will be cleaned up soon. Please save all work in the environment to source control or storage external to the environment before it is deleted. Once the environment has been deleted, the admin can restor it for up to 7 days.

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: Warning: Your Power Platform Environment will be deleted soon

inputs.name: FlowName
inputs.value: DLP Editor>Parse impacted resources into CSV

inputs.name: Body
inputs.value:
Hello,

find attachted the exported apps and flows identified by the DLP Editor for offline analysis.

Thank you

inputs.name: Subject
inputs.value: DLP Impact Analysis - a list of impacted apps and flows is attached
